result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan W Dzwonkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety. Random U.A.'s. No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions

All prescriptions need to be filled at the same pharmacy.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
09:29 AM Defendant Dylan W Dzwonkowski in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1 and 3
Court finds the defendant guilty to Counts 1 and 3. 
Court dismisses and reads in Counts 2 and 4. 

Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 3.5 years
Initial Confinement: 1.5  years
Extended Supervision: 2 years
STAYED for PROBATION

IF REVOKED;
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation: 2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
 No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
 Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
 Inform Agent of all prescriptions
 All prescriptions need to be filled at the same pharmacy.
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:23 AM Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dylan W Dzwonkowski in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze.  

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:29 AM Defendant Dylan W Dzwonkowski in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Attorney Broze states they were Court appointed on the defendants other matter and requests the appointment be extended to this case.  Court swears the defendant as to his current financial circumstances.  The Court will extend the appointment of Attorney Abigail Broze from case 20CM2136 to this case.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
